Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a buff-coloured pottery vessel, the exterior and interior are covered with a red slip, the interior is burnished and bears the remains of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink, the exterior is grooved.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394602) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394602)
